Contempt.definition: willful disobedience or open disrespect of the orders

1.definition: willful disobedience or open disrespect of the orders, authority, or dignity of a court or judge acting in a judicial capacity by disruptive language or conduct or by failure to obey the court's ordersthe offense of contempt called also

civil contempt.definition: contempt that consists of disobedience to a court order in favor of the opposing party
civil contempt.note: The sanctions for civil contempt end upon compliance with the order.

criminal contempt.definition: contempt consisting of conduct that disrupts or opposes the proceedings or power of the court
criminal contempt.note: The sanctions for criminal contempt are designed to punish as well as to coerce compliance.

direct contempt.definition: contempt committed in the presence of the court or in a location close enough to disrupt the court's proceedings

in·di·rect contempt.definition: contempt (as disobedience of a court order) that occurs outside of the presence of the court

2.definition: willful disobedience to a lawful order of or willful obstruction of a legislative body in the course of exercising its powers [ of Congress]
